awd_titl_txt: Order Alpha Squared Corrections to Positronium              Energy Levels and Decay Rates
awd_abstract_narration: The structure of positronium is governed almost                            completely by QED; strong and weak corrections are small                        compared to electrodynamic effects.  This makes it an ideal                     laboratory for studying QED and the bound state formalism in                    quantum field theory.  The objective of the research is to                      study the energy levels and decay rates in positronium.  The                    emphasis will be on the calculation of order alpha2 corrections                 to these energy levels and decay rates and to complete the                      evaluation of the n=1 and n=2 positronium energy levels through                 order m*alpha2.  Completion of these calculations will provide                  an important test of the bound state formalism and QED.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
